business.headline: India's GDP growth may decline to 6.2% in FY26, says NomuraThe assessment, published in a research note on Monday, comes amid what the brokerage describes as a growing "divergence" between headline indicators like GST collections and other key economic metrics such as automobile sales and bank credit growth.

Prostarm Info Systems shares make strong D-Street debut; list at 19% premiumProstarm Info Systems share price: The stock listed at Rs 125 on the BSE, which was 19.04% higher than its issue price of Rs 105. On the NSE, the stock opened at Rs 120, marking a 14.28% premium over its issue price.
Ola Electric shares tumble over 6% today. Here's whyBy 10:15 am, the stock was trading at Rs 50.52, down 5.9%, after reports of a large equity transaction rattled investors.

Yes Bank shares fall 8% after 3 sessions of gain. Here's whyYes Bank's shares fell 7.95% to touch a low of Rs 21.43. This was a huge change from the recent trend, as the stock had risen 8.4% in the previous session and was gaining for three days in a row.

Microsoft cuts over 300 jobs in fresh round of layoffs: ReportThe layoffs come just weeks after the company executed its biggest workforce reduction in recent years, signalling a deeper shift across the industry as artificial intelligence takes center stage.

Adani Ports, Adani Enterprises: Why are Adani Group shares in focus today?As of 9:41 am, both Adani Ports and Adani Enterprises were the top losers on the NSE Nifty50, down 1.5% each. Other companies in the Adani portfolio also saw marginal declines in early trade.

NSE shares surge in unlisted market amid IPO buzz. Here's what analysts sayWith over one lakh retail shareholders, a record for any unlisted Indian company, NSE has become a hotspot in the grey market. But analysts tracking the unlisted space suggest the rally may not be over just yet.
Sensex down 150 points, Nifty below 24,700; Adani Ports falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 226.44 points to 81,147.31, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 45.05 points to 24,671.55 as of 9:29 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market open higher to break recent downtrend?As of 8:15 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,845.5, showing a higher start compared to Nifty50's Monday close of 24,716.6.

Prostarm Info Systems IPO listing: Will it make strong market debut? Check GMPThe listing of Prostarm Info Systems comes at a time when recent mainboard IPOs have not performed very well on debut. Bidding was open from May 27 to May 29, 2025, and saw a total subscription of 96.68 times.

Stocks to watch on June 3: ITC, HCLTech, Biocon, Prostarm Info SystemsThe markets had a shaky start to the week with the Sensex falling over 700 points in early trade, but later recovered to end flat.

Trade deal with India in not-too-distant future: US Commerce SecretaryA trade deal between India and the United States could be finalised soon, as negotiations gain momentum following reciprocal tariff tensions, with US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick expressing optimism that both sides have found common ground.

entertainment.headline: Nobody Wants This Season 2 release date, cast, plot details - all you need to knowIn 'Nobody Wants This Season 1', Adam Brody's Noah and Kristen Bell's Joanne fall in love and try to navigate through their independent identities and family dynamics together. In Season 2, they will face more challenges, and of course, new characters.

Prabhas's long-delayed film The Raja Saab's release date out, teaser on June 16The release date of Prabhas's much-anticipated film, 'The Raja Saab', directed by Maruthi, is out. The makers announced that the teaser will be out this month with the film's release scheduled for December.

Vedang Raina's 25th birthday celebrations with girlfriend Khushi, friends. See picsActor Vedang Raina celebrated his 25th birthday with girlfriend Khushi Kapoor. A picture of the duo from the midnight celebrations has gone viral.

TV actor Vibhu Raghave dies after battle with cancer, funeral to be held todayTV actor Vibhu Raghave died on June 2 in Mumbai after battling stage four colon cancer. Diagnosed in 2022, he shared his journey publicly. His funeral will be held on Tuesday in Jogeshwari West.

Kareena Kapoor, 44, lets in on fitness secrets: Dinner by 6 pm, early workoutsActor Kareena Kapoor Khan shared her sleep and fitness routine, which she follows at the age of 44. In a latest interview, she explained that she believes in early dinners and early morning workouts.

Pankaj Tripathi says he hasn't done any film in last 1 year. Here's whyActor Pankaj Tripathi took a quiet one-year break from films to focus on self-healing and fitness following his father's death. He also explained what prompted him to take this decision.

Ed Sheeran's Sapphire gets SRK touch, singer visits Arijit Singh, Baahubali setEd Sheeran and Shah Rukh Khan created one of the best moments on the Internet with a cute video of them singing the hookline of the singer's upcoming song, 'Sapphire'. Ed Sheeran also gave us a glimpse of his latest Indian tour.

Downton Abbey's last chapter: Trailer promises emotional goodbyeThe Crawleys return in Downton Abbey: The Grand Finale, set in 1930, reuniting beloved characters and introducing new ones. The film premieres September 12, closing the iconic saga with grace.

Disney lays off hundreds globally as part of ongoing restructuring planDisney has laid off several hundred employees globally across departments as part of CEO Bob Iger's restructuring plan to reduce costs and pivot towards streaming, continuing efforts to optimize operations and boost profitability.

Jonathan Joss, 'King of the Hill' actor, fatally shot by neighbour in San AntonioActor Jonathan Joss, known for 'King of the Hill', was fatally shot by a neighbour during an argument in San Antonio. The suspect was arrested and charged with murder. The investigation is ongoing.

RGV criticises backlash against Kamal Haasan's Thug Life, deletes tweet laterFilmmaker Ram Gopal Varma deleted his post where he supported actor Kamal Haasan amid threats to ban 'Thug Life' in Karnataka. Varma questioned democracy over rising intolerance.

Rapper Cardi B confirms relationship with footballer Stefon Diggs, ex Offset reactsAmerican rapper Cardi B's ex-husband Offset subtly reacted to her public romance with NFL star Stefon Diggs. The singer-rapper later deleted his cryptic post.

Fans praise Ishaan Khatter as he grooves to BTS' MIC DropActor Ishaan Khatter shared a clip from his Miss World 2025 performance where he performed on BTS' MIC Drop. Fans compared his dance moves to American singer-musician Bruno Mars.

Rekha's cult classic Umrao Jaan set to return to theatresBollywood classic 'Umrao Jaan', starring Rekha, is returning to theatres on June 27 in a newly restored 4K version. The re-release is accompanied by a special coffee table book offering rare behind-the-scenes insights.

Sonali Bendre on disappointment with Duplicate: Grey role became one-dimensionalActor Sonali Bendre shared her disappointment with her role in 'Duplicate', saying it turned out to be very one-dimensional. She also recalled fun memories with Salman Khan during 'Hum Saath Saath Hain' and spoke about the struggles of shooting in heavy costumes.

Dhanush confirms Vada Chennai 2 filming to begin next yearAfter years of speculation and fan anticipation, Dhanush has officially announced the sequel to his acclaimed gangster drama 'Vada Chennai'. The project will reunite him with director Vetrimaaran, with production to start next year.

Bhool Chuk Maaf OTT release: When and where to watch Rajkummar-Wamiqa starrer filmRajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' will premiere on Prime Video on June 6, just two weeks after its theatrical release. Originally planned for a direct OTT debut, the film hit cinemas on May 23.

Actor Sooraj Pancholi says Bollywood is caught in a vicious cycleActor Sooraj Pancholi spoke about Bollywood's vicious cycle and self-destruction. He urged kindness and unity to save the industry from further downfall.

Kartik Aaryan, Ananya Panday tease youthful romance in Tu Meri Main…first lookKartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday hinted at a youthful love story in the first look poster from their upcoming film, 'Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri'. The film is slated to hit the screens in February 2026.

general news.headline: Even if China reduces...: Himanta Sarma shuts down Pak's Brahmaputra threatThe Assam Chief Minister's remarks come after a senior aide to the Pakistani Prime Minister cautioned that China might also weaponise the Brahmaputra's waters in support of its 'all-weather friend'.

What is India's national language, Kanimozhi was asked in Spain. She said...DMK MP Kanimozhi, who is currently in Spain, was asked about the national language of India. Her response carried a message to the world.

I've done nothing wrong, Indian-origin man shouts as Australian cop 'kneels on neck'An Indian-origin man in Australia is in a coma with critical brain injuries after police allegedly knelt on his neck during an arrest, echoing the George Floyd case in the US.

RCB vs PBKS: 17-year wait, 18th attempt, one dreamIPL 2025 Final, RCB vs PBKS: A new IPL champion will be crowned on Tuesday, June 3, as Royal Challengers Bengaluru clash against Punjab Kings. Rajat Patidar and Shreyas may be the captains, but the focus will be on Virat Kohli.

Usha Vance says PM Modi's sweet gift won over her children: They were hugging himUsha Vance, Second Lady of the United States, shared touching memories of her family's India visit. She recounted her children's delightful encounter with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

We don't need...: Shashi Tharoor's salvo on Trump's ceasefire claim hits Pak tooShashi Tharoor, who is scheduled to visit the US with his all-party delegation, shut down Donald Trump's repeated claims that he mediated a ceasefire between India and Pakistan.

Truth will never...: Kamal Haasan posters in Chennai ahead of Thug Life decisionEven as actor Kamal Haasan faces mounting pressure to apologise for claiming Kannada originated from Tamil, his party supports him through poster campaigns in Chennai. Meanwhile, pro-Kannada groups demand his film Thug Life be banned across Karnataka.

17-year-old TikToker shot dead in Pakistan, honour killing suspectedSana Yousuf, a well-known content creator from Upper Chitral who has over 4 lakh subscribers, was shot at close range by a relative who had come to visit her.

18 for No. 18? Why Virat Kohli deserves to lift the IPL trophyVirat Kohli's IPL journey has been one of brilliance shadowed by heartbreak, but this season, with a balanced and battle-hardened RCB squad, the elusive crown finally feels within reach. After 18 years of near-misses, fate seems poised to hand the icon the crown he's long deserved.
Active Covid cases cross 4,000-mark in India; Gujarat records highest one-day jumpActive Covid cases cross 4,000-mark in India; Gujarat records highest one-day jump

Captain Marvel: Shreyas Iyer a win away from his moment in the sunIPL 2025 Final: Shreyas Iyer led Kolkata Knight Riders to an IPL title last season, but the spotlight never quite found him. Now with Punjab Kings, he's just one win away from carving out a legacy of his own—taking PBKS to their first-ever IPL crown. This is more than just a trophy chase; it's Shreyas's moment to command the respect and recognition he's been chasing all along.

Punjab spy, who shared Army movement details with ISI during Op Sindoor, arrestedGagandeep Singh, a Punjab man who had contacts with Pakistan's ISI and Khalistani terrorist Gopal Singh Chawla, has been arrested for sharing sensitive Army movement details to Pak agents.

D Gukesh's classy reply to Magnus Carlsen potentially quitting classical chessLegendary Magnus Carlsen has said that he is contemplating his future in the classical chess format. Carlsen made his announcement after losing to D Gukesh in the Norway chess tournament.

36 dead, over 5.5 lakh affected as heavy rain continues to lash NortheastNortheast Flood Situation: As heavy rain continues to batter Northeast states, Assam has reported 11 deaths so far, followed by Arunachal Pradesh, where the death toll climbed to 10. In Manipur, over 19,800 people have been affected and more than 3,000 houses damaged.

UP man stabs lover over 30 times with screwdriver, body found in fieldsThe victim, Saira, was stabbed 30 times with a screwdriver, including injuries to her private parts, according to the post-mortem report. The police arrested Saira's boyfriend, Rafi. On Saturday, after her daughter didn't return from the fields, Shafeena went searching and eventually found her bruised and battered body near a temple.

Microsoft cuts over 300 jobs in fresh round of layoffs: ReportThe layoffs come just weeks after the company executed its biggest workforce reduction in recent years, signalling a deeper shift across the industry as artificial intelligence takes center stage.

Bengal woman kills nephew, chops up body, hides remains inside cement wallDuring interrogation, Moumita confessed to the crime, telling police she killed Saddam, cut his body into three pieces, and encased the remains in cement under the stairs at her father's home.

Despite Op Sindoor, India geopolitically weaker than US and China: Ian BremmerDespite being the world's most populous nation, the fourth-largest economy, and a nuclear power, India finds itself in a tricky position when engaging with a leader like Trump, who pressures allies with tariffs and threats, geopolitical analyst Ian Bremmer noted.

Centre rules out special Parliament session on Op Sindoor as Opposition clamoursGovernment sources said there is no justification for a special session of Parliament at this time, adding that the Opposition itself lacks consensus on the issue.

Military training from Class 1 onwards to instill patriotism: Maharashtra ministerMaharashtra Education Minister Dada Bhuse said that basic military training will be given to students from Class 1 in the state. He added that retired soldiers will be called in to train the children.

Elon Musk's Tesla not interested in manufacturing cars in India: Union MinisterThe Union Minister said that Tesla is not expected to begin manufacturing vehicles in India in the near future. He mentioned that the company is currently interested only in opening showrooms in the country.

sports.headline: Pardeep Narwal retires after going unsold in Pro Kabaddi League auctionKabaddi star Pardeep Narwal confirmed his retirement after going unsold in the PKL 2025 auction. His next chapter focusses on coaching and nurturing future talent in kabaddi.

The RCB remontada: How bowling, Kohli non-dependence have them on brink of IPL titleOnce considered to be two of their main weak points, RCB's bowling and non-dependence on big names have guided the franchise to their fourth IPL final. Can these two factors turn out to be the reasons for their first championship win?

Neeraj Chopra Classic 2025 in Bengaluru rescheduled to July 5The Neeraj Chopra Classic 2025, which was earlier set to take place on May 24 and was postponed indefinitely, will now be held on July 5 in Bengaluru.

Ahmedabad Weather Forecast Live: RCB vs PBKS Final: Are there chances of rain?RCB vs PBKS weather Prediction report, IPL Final: The summit clash at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad is expected to be a cracker, but there is a chance of rain in Ahmedabad, which could lead to delays and interruptions.

RCB vs PBKS: What happens if IPL Final gets washed out due to rain?RCB vs PBKS: The Indian Premier League final is likely to be affected by rain. What does the BCCI rules say in case the match does not get completed on Tuesday, June 3.

Ponting seeks redemption, Flower validation in battle of contrasting stylesThe IPL 2025 final maybe all about the big names in RCB and PBKS camps but Ricky Ponting and Andy Flower have shined in their roles as the respective coaches of the franchises. Ponting and Flower have stood out with their unique coaching approaches in the 2025 season.

Kohli is going to pick a battle with someone in IPL final: Varun AaronRCB vs PBKS: Virat Kohli will walk out in the IPL final and pick a fight with someone, predicted Varun Aaron ahead of the summit clash. Varun said, doing that helps Kohli stay tuned into the game.

RCB vs PBKS Live: What does the weather look like in Ahmedabad?RCB (Bengaluru) vs PBKS (Punjab), IPL 2025 Final Live Score and Updates from Ahmedabad: Shreyas Iyer's Punjab Kings and Rajat Patidar's Royal Challengers Bengaluru meet in the final of the Indian Premier League 2025. A new champion is set to be crowned as these two teams collide at the Narendra Modi Stadium on Tuesday. But the match is expected to be marred by rain.

Unstoppable Jannik Sinner into quarters, inspired Bublik stuns Jack DraperFrench Open 2025: Jannik Sinner secured a commanding straight-sets win over Andrey Rublev to reach his third Roland Garros quarterfinals. Alexander Bublik caused an upset by defeating Jack Draper in four sets on Monday.

Calm after the storm, Magnus Carlsen praises Gukesh's fighting skillsMagnus Carlsen acknowledged D Gukesh's energy and fighting qualities after his shock loss to the world champion in Round 6 of Norway Chess 2025.

IPL final predicted XI, team news: Will RCB get Tim David boost?IPL 2025 final, RCB vs PBKS: Royal Challengers Bengaluru will hope to have their big-hitting finisher TIm David back for the big clash. Yuzvendra Chahal, meanwhile, is a doubtful starter for Punjab Kings due to a wrist injury.

Pro-Kohli crowd in IPL final: PBKS coach ready for tough battle in AhmedabadPunjab's fast-bowling coach James Hopes said his team would be "recovering and getting mentally prepared" for what he expects will be "a pretty big crowd, and a pretty big pro-Kohli crowd as well, in the IPL 2025 final in Ahmedabad."

India A batters shine, bowlers struggle vs England Lions in drawn unofficial TestAfter the England Lions posted 587 in reply to India A's 557, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Abhimanyu Easwaran, Dhruv Jurel and Nitish Kumar Reddy made the most of batting-friendly conditions with fluent half-centuries, gaining valuable confidence ahead of the second unofficial Test in Northampton on June 6.

Boisson lowest-ranked quarterfinalist in 40 years, Zverev rolls onFrench Open 2025: Loïs Boisson stunned world No. 3 Jessica Pegula to become the lowest-ranked player to reach the Roland Garros quarterfinals in 40 years. Fellow American Madison Keys held off a late challenge from Hailey Baptiste, while teenager Mirra Andreeva became the youngest player in nearly 30 years to reach back-to-back French Open quarterfinals.

French Open: Djokovic breezes into quarters, secures 100th win at Roland GarrosNovak Djokovic secured his 100th win at Roland Garros and made it to his 19th quarter-final at the French Open with a straight-sets win over Cameron Norrie on Monday, June 2. Djokovic joined Nadal in an elite list with his win on Monday.

Monk-like Ricky Ponting amazing man manager: Shreyas IyerIPL 2025: Captain Shreyas Iyer credited Ricky Ponting's calm leadership and equal treatment of players as a key reason behind Punjab Kings' resurgence in IPL 2025, as they prepare to face RCB in the historic final.

Relaxed and ready: Shreyas Iyer, Rajat Patidar share laughs before big finalIPL 2025 Final: On the eve of a high-stakes IPL final with history on the line, captains Shreyas Iyer and Rajat Patidar kept the mood light, trading laughs and banter in a surprisingly relaxed press conference in Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium.

I couldn't sleep: Shreyas Iyer keeps fire burning bright ahead of IPL 2025 finalShreyas Iyer said he barely slept after Punjab Kings' dramatic win over Mumbai Indians, a result that sealed their place in the IPL 2025 final. Iyer, however, admitted he remains restless as Punjab prepares to face Royal Challengers Bangalore in the title clash in Ahmedabad.

Will BCCI retire Virat Kohli's No.18 jersey from Tests after retirement?The Indian Test team won't have anyone wearing Virat Kohli's No.18 jersey in the near future after the star batter announced his retirement from the format in May. Mukesh Kumar was seen wearing the jersey number during India A's match against England Lions.

RCB vs PBKS: Head-to-head and key player battles to watch out forIPL 2025 Final, RCB vs PBKS: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) will take on Punjab Kings (PBKS) at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Tuesday, June 3, in the final of the Indian Premier League 2025.

IPL 2025 Final, RCB vs PBKS Live-streaming: When and where to watchRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings are set to clash in the IPL 2025 Final, each aiming to lift their maiden title at Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium in what promises to be an iconic showdown.

Captains Shreyas Iyer, Rajat Patidar pose with IPL title ahead of final in AhmedabadCaptains Shreyas Iyer and Rajat Patidar posed with the IPL title ahead of the final in Ahmedabad on Tuesday, June 3. RCB and PBKS will square off as IPL will see a new champion being crowned in Ahmedabad on Tuesday.

Winning IPL 2025 will mean a lot for Virat Kohli and RCB fans: Rajat PatidarRajat Patidar said that winning the IPL 2025 title will mean a lot for Virat Kohli and RCB fans ahead of the final against PBKS on Tuesday, June 3. Kohli has been the star with the bat for RCB this season.

England to host Women's T20 World Cup 2026: Dates and venues confirmedThe ICC has announced the dates for the upcoming Women's T20 World Cup 2026, which will be hosted in England from June 12 to July 5, featuring 33 matches across seven iconic venues.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
